content.statement: aaa-016-juxtarenal is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Aaa Definitions that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding aaa-016-juxtarenal helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of aaa-016-juxtarenal include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of aaa-016-juxtarenal.

definitions_glossary.juxtarenal: Immediately adjacent to the renal arteries without involving their origins
definitions_glossary.pararenal: Aneurysm involving one or both renal artery origins
definitions_glossary.suprarenal: Aneurysm extending above both renal arteries
definitions_glossary.infrarenal_neck: The segment of normal aorta between the renal arteries and the aneurysm
definitions_glossary.fenestrated_EVAR: Endovascular repair using a graft with holes aligned to visceral vessel origins
definitions_glossary.cold_perfusion: Renal protection technique using chilled crystalloid solution during ischemia

presentation: Usually asymptomatic and discovered incidentally on imaging
May present with flank pain if rapidly expanding
Hydronephrosis possible from ureteral compression by aneurysm
Rarely, renal artery compromise causing renovascular hypertension

anatomic_criteria.renal_involvement: Renal artery origins NOT within aneurysm sac

diagnosis: CT angiography is the gold standard for operative planning
3D reconstruction essential for fenestrated EVAR planning
Centerline measurements for accurate neck assessment
Assessment of renal function (eGFR) and split renal function if concern

open_repair.reconstruction: Tube or bifurcated graft with reimplantation of accessories

fenestrated_EVAR.fenestrations: Aligned with renal arteries, ±celiac/SMA if needed
fenestrated_EVAR.advantages: Avoids renal ischemia, lower perioperative morbidity

chimney_snorkel.indication: Urgent cases where custom FEVAR unavailable

open_repair.long_term_survival: Comparable to infrarenal repair if survived perioperative period

definition.@value: Abdominal aortic aneurysm with inadequate infrarenal neck (<10-15mm) requiring suprarenal clamping or fenestrated endovascular repair

sources.source: Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.

learning_objectives: Define juxtarenal AAA using anatomic neck criteria
Distinguish juxtarenal from pararenal and suprarenal aneurysms
Understand the implications of suprarenal clamping on renal function
Compare open repair vs fenestrated EVAR for juxtarenal anatomy
Describe renal protection strategies during open repair
clinical_pearls: Hostile neck features: short (<15mm), angulated (>60°), thrombus (>2mm), conical shape
Cold renal perfusion (4°C) extends safe clamp time from 25 to >45 minutes
FEVAR eliminates renal ischemia but requires 6-12 weeks for custom manufacturing
30% of juxtarenal cases have accessory renal arteries requiring preservation
Suprarenal clamp time >30 minutes significantly increases AKI risk

medicalCode.description: Endovascular repair of visceral aorta with 2 or more visceral artery endoprostheses
